File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shadowland\SCL_Pixie_InsideLantern.lsj
Synopsis:
The player has received a magical lantern - the Moonlantern - which protects against an evil curse. Hearing a voice from the lantern you examine it and find there's a pixie trapped inside, which gives it its power. The pixie is desperate and begs to be let out, as the lantern is killing it. If you release it, the pixie will grant you immunity from the curse, but only for one day. The pixie has two modes: Cute rhyming fairtyale Disney pixie (a put on) and evil vile little fey creature (true self)

> I know the feeling. We've got to set her free.
> Seems like a fitting punishment for a poet.
> Poor thing - a life of torture! We should let her go. Shouldn't we?
> Cruelty and cleverness are all too common bedfellows. Let's side with cleverness alone, shall we? See what we can do to save this verse-loving pixie.

uid: ffd7a90f-7dd1-fd18-2b5d-9314acf493af

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch0_Hotfix2_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shadowland\SCL_Drider_HarpersAndPlayersAmbush.lsj
Synopsis:
The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.

0:0 - That lantern is mine - by order of the Absolute. Drop it, or I'll boil your brain inside your skull.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shadowland\SCL_Drider_PlayersAmbush.lsj
Synopsis:
The players have agreed to help the Harpers ambush a caravan of Absolute cultists and prisoners. You've just arrived at the ambush site - the mood is tense, words are spoken in harsh whispers. When the Caravan arrives there's a monsterous drider at its head, muttering to itself, talking to an imaginary queen/majesty that represents the voice of his God, The Absolute. The player can try to trick the drider into handing over its magic lantern (the Moonlantern - a glowing lantern hanging from the end of a staff), although that could leave the drider exposed to the worst effects of the curse. Will likely end in combat, either because you signaled the Harpers to spring their ambush or because the drider got suspicious and attacked.

0:0 - She has blessed the lantern's light. It is the Absolute who protects us from the shadows.

Synopsis:
Players enter SCL for the first time through the mountain pass. They reflect upon having had a difficult journey. If a second party member is present, they'll point out that you're not alone.The camera then pans to show a group of Absolute cultists nearby, waiting for the drider to guide them. If Minthara has given you the mission to go to SCL the group will be a mix of half-orcs and goblins and the 2nd character will recognise them as the cultists you were looking for. If Minthara has NOT given you the mission to go to SCL the group will just be two goblins.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shadowland\SCL_EntryPoint_PAD_AfterCutscene.lsj
Synopsis:
PAD for party banter when players enter SCL, after the cutscene (either SCL_EntryPoint_Mountain.lsj or SCL_EntryPoint_Underdark.lsj, depending on which entrance is used). Lines are generic enough about the shadow curse/look of the land that they work for both entrances to SCL. Two lines from one companion if only one companion present.

0:0 - I lived in the shadows for centuries, but never found darkness this unsettling.
1:0 - I know the dark of wildspace. But I've never known a dark like this.
2:0 - Shrouded in no ordinary shadows. What evil lurks within such darkness?
3:0 - There's a familiar power to these shadows... neither fully comforting or threatening.
4:0 - This place is darker than dark, as if the shadows could cast shadows.
5:0 - Kind of beautiful - but also feels like you could choke on your own breath here.
6:0 - Even in the Underdark, I never saw gloom like this. It's unsettling.
7:0 - I've never seen darkness like this before. It's unsettling.
uid: 330caae4-88dc-485d-ad59-d0c876b7e0f7
- 0:0 Tag: Underdark - Character internally belongs to an Underdark race (Being raised in the Underdark casts a cruel shadow on one's view of the world, even up on the surface.)
> Alas, this is the only path to Moonrise Towers. So into the dark I go. But it's the only path to Moonrise Towers. I have to push forward. Moonrise Towers lies ahead. I must keep going, however bleak the path. No matter. Moonrise Towers has to remain the focus. Well - I've got to push through. Unless a passing griffon offers a ride, it's the only way to Moonrise Towers. Only way to Moonrise, unfortunately. But if this is the way to Moonrise Towers, then this is the only path I've got.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shadowland\SCL_MastiffPoachers_TrueSoul_Dead.lsj
Synopsis:
SwD dialog for dead True Soul that died of hunger/thirst while hiding from Shadow Mastiffs in the island of light. They used Continual Flame spell to make torches around them ever-burning, which allowed them to hide there indefinitely (until they died). The kicker - description of the spell says that each casting uses Ruby Dust worth 50gp, so, presumably, that's one rich True Soul.

Dialog with Oliver, in which the player confronts him and convinces him to rejoin Thaniel, his other half. so that the shadow curse can be lifted. Oliver will always return to Thaniel after this dialogue, but the player can be harsh or gentle in how they do so.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Act2\Shadowland\SCL_OliversDiary_OliverShadow.lsj
Synopsis:
Dialog with Oliver, the shadow-child in the Shadowcursed Lands. Oliver wishes for the player to be his playmate, and engages in a game of hide and seek. Oliver seems to be a soul trapped by the curse for a 100 years, but the player will gradually realise over the course of the act that he is in fact a shadow version of Thaniel, the spirit of the land. Oliver possesses Thaniel's heart, and the curse cannot be lifted until it is returned. Oliver does not want to do this - he's made his own little 'family' using cursed beings in the area. If the player challenges him about Thaniel, Oliver will flee towards the town square, where a final confrontation will take place.

0:0 - This land needs you and Thaniel together, Oliver. Nature needs you.
uid: 00a0200a-e6ee-b218-6475-3e50e847fffb
- 0 Check flag(s) (Tag):
   true - Druid - A priest of the Old Faith, wielding the powers of nature and adopting animal forms. (Druids channel the elemental forces of nature and share a deep kinship with animals. Mastery of Wild Shape allows them to transform into beasts from all over the Realms.)
> You can't make me do anything I don't want to. I won't let you.

0:0 - You did better than most though, so I'll let you go. Here - second prize. You'll need it.
